    • Method Detail

      • require

        public static Consumer require(Parser parser)
        Returns a parser that creates a node according to the parser parameter. Converts all ParseExceptions into FatalParseExceptions.

        Parameters:
        parser - The parser that will create the node
        Returns:
        The composite parser

      • strip

        public static Parser strip(Consumer parser,
           CharacterMatcher strip)
        Returns a parser that creates a node according to the parser parameter except that all characters accepted by the strip matcher is removed before and after the parsed section.

        Equivalent to:

        lsequence(ignore(strip), parser, ignore(strip))

        Example:

        strip(matches(Matchers.digit()), Matchers.white())

        Parameters:
        parser - The parser that will create the node
        strip - The matcher that indicates characters to strip.
        Returns:
        The composite parser

      • strip

        public static Parser strip(Consumer parser)
        Returns a parser that creates a node according to the parser parameter except that all (non-line-delimiting) whitespace before and after the parsed section is removed.

        Equivalent to:

        strip(parser, Matchers.white())

        Parameters:
        parser - The parser that will create the node
        Returns:
        The composite parser

      • matches

        public static Parser matches(CharacterMatcher matcher)
        Returns a parser that creates a node with all characters accepted by the matcher.

        Successful matching requires at least one matching character.

        Equivalent to:

        matches(1, -1, matcher)

        Parameters:
        matcher - The matcher to collect characters
        Returns:
        The parser

      • matches

        public static Parser matches(int min,
             CharacterMatcher matcher)
        Returns a parser that creates a node with all characters accepted by the matcher.

        Successful matching requires at least min matching character(s).

        Equivalent to:

        matches(min, -1, matcher)

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum number of matching characters for this parser to return successfully.
        matcher - The matcher to collect characters
        Returns:
        The parser

      • matches

        public static Parser matches(int min,
             int max,
             CharacterMatcher matcher)
        Returns a parser that creates a node with all characters accepted by the matcher.

        Successful matching requires at least min matching character(s).

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum number of matching characters for this parser to return successfully.
        max - The maximum number of matching characters for this parser to return successfully.
        matcher - The matcher to collect characters
        Returns:
        The parser

      • matches

        public static Parser matches(int min,
             int max,
             char... chars)
        Returns a parser that creates a node with all characters accepted by the matcher.

        Successful matching requires at least min matching character(s) but will never match more than max matching characters.

        Equivalent to:

        matches(min, max, Matchers.match(chars))

        Parameters:
        min - The minimum number of matching characters for this parser to return successfully.
        max - The maximum number of matching characters for this parser to return successfully.
        chars - The characters to match
        Returns:
        The parser

      • exact

        public static Parser exact(java.lang.String token)
        Returns a parser matches exactly the provided string.

        Parameters:
        token - The string to match
        Returns:
        The parser

        public static Parser oneOf(java.lang.String... alternatives)
        Returns a parser matches exactly one of the provided strings.

        Parameters:
        alternatives - The strings to match
        Returns:
        The parser

      • group

        public static Parsers.Group group(java.lang.String name,
                  Consumer parser)
        Creates a grouping consumer. Mostly useful for debugging. Transparently delegates the consume() call to the provided parser.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the group
        parser - The parser to delegate to
        Returns:
        The group
